bibl.title: State of Nebraska DEPARMENT OF Trade and Commerce Bureau of Insurance Summary of Insurance Business in Nebraska for the year 1931

p.seg: State of Nebraska DEPARTMENT OF Trade and Commerce Bureau of Insurance Summary of Insurance Business in Nebraska for the year 1931 Also Comparative Figures of Authorized Companies for the years 1926, 1929 and 1930

To His Excellency, 'Governor Charles W. Bryan: We respectfully submit the summary of business of companies authorized to write insurance m this State for the year ending De - cember 31, 1931. DEPARTMENT OP TRADE AND COMMERCE, E. H. LUIKART, Secretary. LEE HERDMAN, Acting Commissioner of Insurance and Securities.

NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT COMPANIES REINSURING, MERGING, OR WITHDRAWING FROM NEBRASKA FROM JANUARY 1, 1981 TO JUNE 1, 1982. Aero Indemnity Company, of New York, withdrew as of April 30, 1932. ■ Aero Insurance Company, of New York, withdrew as of April 30, 1932. American Fire and Marine, Galveston, Texas, merged with American Indemnity Company, Galveston, Tex., 1931. American. Merchants Marine Insurance Company of New York, with - drew as of December 29, 1931. Belt Fire Ins., Co., Los Angeles, Calif., withdrew as of April 30, 1932. Bronx Fire Insurance Company of New York, merged with New York Fire Ins. Co. of New York, November 17, 1931. \ Chicago Fire & Marine Ins. Co., Chicago, 111., merged with Lincoln Fire Ins. Co. of New York, December 31, 1931. Commonwealth Casualty Company of Philadelphia, Pa., consolidated with Independence Indemnity Company of Philadelphia, June 30, 1931. Des Moines Life and Annuity Company, merged with Royal Union Life of Des Moines, Iowa, June 16, 1931. Empire State Ins. Co., Watertown, N. Y., merged with Great Lakes Ins. Co., Chicago, 111., December 31, 1931. Employers Casualty Co., Dallas, Tex., withdrew as of April 30, 1932. Export Indemnity Company, New York, withdrew as of April 30, 1932. Farmers Life Ins. Co., Denver, Colo., reinsured by Pacific States Life Ins. Co., of Hollywood, Calif., 1931. Farmers Mutual Tornado Fire & Livestock Ins. Co., Cass County, re - insured by Farmers Mutual Ins. Co. of Lincoln, January 9, 1932. Federal Surety Company of Davenport, Iowa, placed in hands of Re - ceiver September 25, 1931. Great Lakes Ins. Co., Chicago, 111., reinsured by Public Fire Ins. Co., Newark, N. J., December 31, 1931. Independence Fire Ins. Co. of Philadelphia, merged with American Equitable Assurance Company of N. Y., October 13, 1931. Iowa National Fire Ins. Co., Des Moines, withdrew as of April 30, 1932. Jefferson County Assessment Ass'n., Diller, Nebr., liquidated. LaSalle Fire Insurance Company, New Orleans, La., withdrew as of April 30, 1932. Modern Brotherhood of America, Mason City, Iowa, merged and con - solidated with Independent Order of Foresters, Toronto, Canada, November 7, 1931. Monarch Accident Insurance Company, Springfield, Mass., merged with Monarch Life Insurance Company, Springfield, Mass., January 1, 1932. National Union Assurance Society, Toledo, Ohio, withdrew as of April 30, 1932. ■■■-■' • ■ - .

NEBRASKA INSURANCE REPORT COMPANIES CHANGING NAME OB PLAN American Indemnity Association, Lincoln, Neb., amended Articles ot Incorporation to write life insurance in addition to accident and health, on the .mutual legal reserve plan, and name to American Indemnity Life Insurance Co. Fidelity Old Line Insurance Co., Omaha, Nebr., changed plan to Burial May 31, 1932. First American Insurance Company, Lincoln, Nebr., changed from an assessment to mutual plan, June 22, 1931. Guarantee Fund Life Association, Omaha, Nebr., changed plan to mutual legal reserve and name to Guarantee Mutual Life Com - pany, July 1, 1931. Inter-State Business Men's Accident Association, Des Molnes, Iowa, changed plan from assessment to mutual casualty and name to Inter-State Business Men's Accident Company, February 10, 1931. National Hall Insurance Company, Omaha, Nebraska, changed plan to assessment and name to Nebraska National Insurance Company, July 21, 1931. National Old Line Life Insurance Company, licensed to write life In - surance, December 29, 1931. Old Republic Life Insurance Co., changed name to Old Republic Credit Life Insurance Company, April 30, 1931. Plate Glass Reciprocal Underwriters, Kansas City, Mo., changed name to Allied Underwriters, March 1, 1932. Utilities Indemnity Exchange, St. Louis, Mo., reorganized as a stock casualty company and changed name to Utilities Insurance Com - pany, January 20, 1932 Western Reciprocal Underwriters, Kansas City, Mo., changed plan to mutual fire and name to Western Underwriters Mutual Insurance Company, March 18, 1932.
